article:
The 'Infancy Gospel of Thomas' is a pseudepigraphical gospel about the childhood
of Jesus that dates to the 2nd and 3rd centuries. It was part of a popular genre
of biblical work, written to satisfy a hunger among early Christians for more
miraculous and anecdotal stories of the childhood of Jesus than the Gospel of
Luke provided. Later references by Hippolytus of Rome and Origen of Alexandria
to a Gospel of Thomas are more likely to be referring to this Infancy Gospel
than to the wholly different [[Gospel of Thomas]] with which it is sometimes
confused. It would appear to be unrelated to the Canonical Gospels.
